key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA channels consistently show higher pricing compared to Air Baltic's website, with a frequency of over 95%, indicating a substantial price differential.
MSE channels demonstrate a unique opportunity with 45% of cases showing lower prices than Air Baltic's website, albeit with a decreasing trend.
GDS channels predominantly exhibit higher prices than Air Balticâ€™s website, maintaining a 98% frequency of such instances.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, Air Baltic's pricing is consistently higher on OTAs with a frequency over 95%.
There are no cases where OTA prices are lower than the website prices, indicating a strong pricing differential.
The price discrepancies between website and OTA have maintained stability, with changes below 0.1% on average.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances of OTA not having a comparable offer are minimal, having steady occurrences of around 3.45%.
OTA instances with higher prices compared to the Air Baltic website are predominant, consistently around 96.5%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul routes, OTAs consistently show over 95% higher pricing compared to the Air Baltic website.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For routes originating in Latvia, OTA prices are higher approximately 95.4% of the time.
Stability in OTA higher pricing for non-Latvia origins at 97.7%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in booking windows, OTAs have higher prices 94.9% of the time.
All far-out booking instances have shown 100% higher prices on OTAs versus the website.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel primarily shows lower prices than Air Baltic's website, accounting for about 45% of observations.
Price matching between the MSE channel and Air Baltic's website has remained stable.
The frequency of lower prices on the MSE channel decreased by nearly 3% week-over-week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Approximately 26% of itineraries were priced identically on the MSE channel and Air Baltic's website.
MSE showed a 45% incidence of prices being lower than the airline's website, although this trend is decreasing.
Prices on the MSE channel that were higher than the website saw a rise in frequency by 2.63% last week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: The short-haul market exhibited a 45% incidence of fares being cheaper on MSE, with a decreasing trend in lower pricing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In Latvia-origin flights, 53.49% of fares were lower on the MSE channel.
Higher recorded frequencies of MSE showing higher prices by 0.85% week-over-week for non-Latvia origins.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings favored the MSE channel, with 56.9% lower prices compared to the airline's website.
In the far-out booking window, MSE prices were higher than website prices for 53.57% of itineraries.

gds_highlights.line_content: Prices in the GDS channel are consistently higher, with over 98% frequency in comparisons.
Minimal change in instances where the GDS channel has the same or lower prices indicates a stable trend of higher pricing.
The frequency of website offers not available on GDS is below 2%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where website offers are not found on GDS occur less than 2% of the time.
No significant occurrences of the same price offers in GDS compared with the website.
The GDS channel frequently has higher prices than the website, with frequencies near 98%-100%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_title: Short Haul Dominance of Higher Pricing
gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul flights, prices are consistently higher on GDS with nearly identical frequency to overall patterns.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From Latvia, prices on the GDS are higher 100% of the time, slightly increasing by 2.33 percentage points.
For non-LV origins, high GDS pricing frequency remains stable at approximately 97.67%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in booking windows, GDS channel prices are higher over 98% of the time.
In far-out bookings, the GDS consistently shows 100% higher pricing compared to the airline's site.
